instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Early 2014 weird behavior
threads.message:
Got this MacBook Air 2014 today. It is slightly water damaged, I can see some corrosion around <CHIP>U5450</CHIP> (replaced this) and at the trackpad cable (cleaned this one).
It turns on when connecting the charger, the fan spins high all the time. It only has green light some of the time, it does not see battery. I have tried with a new IO board and signal cable.
When trying to install macOS it stops telling me it cannot install if not connected to a power outlet, which of course it is.
I will not turn off while holding down the power button.
I have tried the board with a new keyboard and new trackpad. Both the old and the new keyboard/trackpad combination seems to work fine in macOS.

As far as I can tell there is no ASD for this board, or can I use ASD for the 2013 model since it has the same logic board?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Early 2014 weird behavior
threads.message:
Power button issue and fan runs high because of bad trackpad cable and or connector on the  board.
If there is no green light it is probably bad IO board/cable/connector on the board, inspect for corroded pins.
Battery issue can be battery/SMC/<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>
ASD is 3S156.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Early 2014 weird behavior
threads.message:
Thank you,
There is no corrosion on the IO board connectors, and I have already tried a new IO board and cable.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Early 2014 weird behavior
threads.message:
No green light also happens when the power button hangs. So it could be corrosion on trackpad/cable/connector/bad keyboard. This would also explain the battery not recognized and the fan on high.
Measure <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL>

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Early 2014 weird behavior
threads.message: A small breakthrough, i saw one corroded pin at the diagnostics port, so I removed it. Sorry I did't notice sooner. Now it has orange/green light an no high fan spin :)

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Early 2014 weird behavior
threads.message: Crap, only worked for Ã¥ few minutes, now it is back again :(

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Early 2014 weird behavior
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Early 2014 weird behavior
threads.message: And now it is fine again with <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> at 3.42

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Early 2014 weird behavior
threads.message: It's very unstable, one minute it works fine and the next the fan blows like crazy and <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> turns low again :(

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Early 2014 weird behavior
threads.message: I'm tossing it in the ultrasonic now to see if it helps

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Early 2014 weird behavior
threads.message:
Just an update here, cleaned the board and the trackpad cable and after that the fan started acting normal and keyboard functions as it should. 
Battery wouldn't charge before I did an SMC reset. Everything is fine now.
